result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane R Curtin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid within 90 days after release from jail, or penalty of 10 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.
Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 113 Days were granted.
Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Case 14CF579 was dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shane R Curtin in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Counts #1, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding  sentencing.  Defendant's brother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:   

6 MONTHS JAIL - STRAIGHT TIME - (CREDIT - 113 days)

____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid within 90 days after release from jail, alternate 10 days jail if not paid)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Shane R Curtin in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to 10/20/14 with other case.  Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Shane R Curtin in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Masnica requests a jury status and jury trial and files speedy trial demand on Defendant's other (older) case.   Bail remains as fixed.  Court adjourns along with other case set for Jury status hearing scheduled on October 16, 2014.  Hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shane R Curtin in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Masnica advised court that she has not received a consolidated offer as of yet from the State.  Court reschedules hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Shane R Curtin in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
